alert.note: Alert for Manistee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 11:36PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Manistee County through 1230 AM EDT... At 1136 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Arcadia to 23 miles west of Manistee. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bear Lake, Wildwood and Pierport around 1140 PM EDT. Onekama around 1150 PM EDT. Kaleva and Norwalk around 1155 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Orchard Beach State Park, Manistee, Eastlake, Parkdale and Brethren. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
